title: bash ls owner in user's C: dirs should NOT be root
body: When I've done a "cd /mnt/c/Users/${LOGNAME}" and then do an "ls -l", files (and dirs) are improperly listed as owned by uid=root, gid=root.  The system knows the primary owner and group, so show that -- AND have operations obey the implied permissions.

comments.body: I noticed this too - my first response was "humm that's not right?" So when I do an ls on ubuntu 17.04 fresh install /etc is owned by root:root so it seems to mirror what is on the physical system in WSL.  I do not think this is an issue; I could be missing something in my thought process about this.
